member.name: M:SGCore.Kinematics.Quat.LookRotation(SGCore.Kinematics.Vect3D,SGCore.Kinematics.Vect3D)
member.summary: Calculate the Quat that, when applied to the "forward" axis and "up axis", results in the input vectors." In Unity notation, "forward" is Z, and "up" is Y.

member.name: M:SGCore.Kinematics.Quat.LookRotation_XYZ(SGCore.Kinematics.Vect3D,SGCore.Kinematics.Vect3D,SGCore.Kinematics.Vect3D)
member.summary: Calculate the Quaternion that, when applied to (1, 0, 0), (0, 1, 0) and (0, 0, 1) will result in teh vectors X, Y, Z.
member.param: In Orignal function - Side, calculated from Cross Up(input)-FWD, Unity (2D) Left/Right
In Orignal function - UP, re-calculated from Cross SIDE-FWD, Unity (2D) Up/Down
In Orignal function - Forward, Unity Z (towards screen)
member.remarks: Based on the implementation at https://gist.github.com/aeroson/043001ca12fe29ee911e or https://answers.unity.com/questions/467614/what-is-the-source-code-of-quaternionlookrotation.html, refactored somewhat to make it more readable, and added comments that reflect my own hand solved variables based on the sources from Quat.Rotate.

members.member: Interface for the Android Library Since there is no Native Bluetooth SDK for Android, we have to use .aar files for now. There is no way to import such methods in C#, nor easily in C++. So instead, our Unity back-end handles Sending/Receiving to the API, and data ends up in this class.

member.name: M:SGCore.CV.CV_Kinematics.CalculateHandAngles(SGCore.CV.CV_HandTrackingData,SGCore.Kinematics.Quat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The actual hand angle calculations. First we define a "working plane"; joint start rotation + abduction. j0 flexion is calculated using aTan2, j1 flexion using vector.anglebetween. finally, j2 flexion is calculated using aTan2 again, using j0's reference frame.

member.name: T:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother
member.summary: Keeps track of a small history of CV Outputs to compensate for low(er) update rates. For example, running a VR simulation at 90Hz while sampling at 30.

member.name: T:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.SmoothingMethod
member.summary: The way handPoses are smoothed in this class.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.SmoothingMethod.None
member.summary: None. You'll always get the latest pose received. No performance increase, but might result in a "stop-motion" effect on lower framerates.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.SmoothingMethod.InterpolateBehind
member.summary: Pretend you're one sample behind, and interpolate along the exact paths. More accurate, but we will lag 1 frame behind.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.SmoothingMethod.ExtrapolateAhead
member.summary: Take the last two handPoses and estimate the current values based on extrapolation. Is percieved as "faster", but is more likely to overhoot during sudden changes in direction.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.initialInput
member.summary: What the HandPos was originally made for. Used to deterime which DeviceType / Handedness / subHW version this data was generated for.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.maxDataPoints
member.summary: The maximum amount of points we keep track of for smoothed hand data.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.lastFrames
member.summary: The last X amount of frames this data keeps in memory.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.smoothMethod
member.summary: The way in which we're smoothing the incoming data

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.lastSmoothedData
member.summary: When using SmoothingMethod.ExtrapolateAhead: The last dmoothed data, used to determine projection and PosAtPrediction when both are null.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.projection
member.summary: When using SmoothingMethod.ExtrapolateAhead: What the next frame is estimated to look like, based on the last two data points.

member.name: F:SGCore.CV.CV_HandDataSmoother.posAtPrediction
member.summary: When using SmoothingMethod.ExtrapolateAhead: The variables we had calculated to be at during the last GetSmoothedPose call.
member.remarks: Interpolating from this to the projection as opposed to the last two frames, so that we don't "jump" around.

member.summary: Create a new instance of Smoothed Hand Data, using a first frame.

member.summary: Set the Force-Feedback value of a particular finger to a specific level
member.param: Value will be clamped between [0...1], where 0.0f means no Force-Feedback, and 1.0 means full force-feedback.
The finger to which to send the command.

member.summary: Take all active commands in the device queue, compile them into one and send them to the device.

member.remarks: Generic function across any Haptic Interface in SGCore

member.summary: Whether or not this Waveform is infinitely repeating

member.summary: The amount of times to repeat this waveform. 1 is the default. If set to 0, repreats indefinitely.

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.AttackTime
member.summary: Time, in seconds, before the signal reaches its maximum amplitude. Limited to 0.01 - 1s. Set to 0 for an instant start. Linear only

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.SustainTime
member.summary: Time, in seconds, to keep the signal at one Amplidue. Limited to 0.01 - 1s.

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.DecayTime
member.summary: Time it takes for the effect to fade out after AttackTime+SuatainTime has passed. Limited to 0.01 - 1s. Set to 0 for instant stop. Linear only

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.FrequencyStart
member.summary: The Wavefrom Frequency at the start of the wavefrom. Limited between [10 - 500Hz] for Nova Gloves

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.FrequencyEnd
member.summary: The Frequency at the end of the waveform. Keep the same as FrequencyStart to have one conitnuous frequency. Limited between [10 - 500Hz] for Nova Gloves

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.FrequencySwitchTime
member.summary: value of [0..1], repesenting a perentage of total time (attack+sustain+decay). After that moment passes, we increase the frequency by FrequencySwicth factor

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.FrequencySwitchFactor
member.summary: After a certain % of the waveform (FrequencySwitchTime) plays, multiply the frequency by this factor [1x .. 3x]

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.EffectTime
member.summary: The total command time of a single play of this pattern (not taking into account the RepeatAmount).

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.TotalEffectTime
member.summary: Total time for the entire effect (effecttime multipled by the repeatamount)

member.name: P:SGCore.CustomWaveform.FrequencyJumps
member.summary: If true, the frequency of this waveform jumps at any time during its playtime by FrequencySwitchFactor.
